post.title: A Long Winded Admission
post.author: Jackson Hayes
post.content:
I need to learn from experience. I often find myself walking to somewhere I have been before and have general sense of where I am. In these situations I often just follow my internal compass and logical reasoning skills. This method gets me places, just not the ones I intend. 

Maps, asking directions, and public transit or cabs should be used instead of my method. 

I admit it, I am not very good with directions. It's a good thing I'm stubborn and persistent or many times I would have found myself clutching my knees crying in a back alley.
